Jaye reports having been sent to the slums to work at a very young age. And thanks to his appearance, as well as his skills with a knife, he was often mistaken for a triad. And since the 'triads' of the Lungmen slums often keep a low profile, mixing in with ordinary folk and setting up front businesses, suspicion fell on Jaye. The misunderstandings and misconceptions piled on top of each other, giving Jaye a reputation as a dangerous man, not to be messed with. Some rumors even labeled him the true puppetmaster behind several different gangs. 
But really, Jaye just wanted to sell his seafood. He'd haul his goods to market, and sometimes help out at the finball shop. The rumors weighed heavily on Jaye. But there was nothing he could do about them.

According to Waai Fu, Jaye is very skilled, and as warm inside as he is cold outside. He is beloved by his regulars, who include Mr. Lee of Lee's Detective Agency, a fan of both Jaye's stall and the finball shop. 
One day, after closing up his stall, Jaye came upon Waai Fu in the midst of her fight against injustice. After they got to know one another, Waai Fu realized it was Jaye's stall Mr. Lee liked so much. And as the old man sent her out on her many errands, she became much closer to Jaye. 
The upstanding Waai Fu would, from time to time, help Jaye deal with problems here and there. But that only served to confirm his reputation as a dangerous killer to the uninitiated. And Waai Fu became known as a Yan kung fu master in his service. 
Though Jaye certainly isn't the professional killer he's sometimes rumored to be, the situation in the slums is still chaotic and complex. Consequently, the question of Jaye's identity endures through the fights and scuffles around him.

So the rumors persist. But this is not to say they are entirely without benefit. 
For example, Hoshiguma developed an interest in Jaye based on these rumors. Upon coming to understand his true nature, she grew concerned for him and ultimately referred him to us at Rhodes Island. 
Hoshiguma knows about old Lungmen. And she tells us that although Jaye is not a triad, he is connected with a certain Uncle Tung, who is a known associate of the Rat King. She says that, entirely unbeknownst to Jaye, this old man has worked to help him. 
It is clear to us that Hoshiguma revealed this information not to bring suspicion upon Jaye, but to prevent any problems or misunderstandings from arising in the future. 
Jaye is just Jaye, a normal civilian who has joined Rhodes Island. And that isn't going to change.

avgList.storyIntro: Jaye's fearsome appearance often brings trouble, but it comes in handy from time to time.

stories.storyText:
[Code Name] Aciddrop
[Gender] Female
[Combat Experience] 1 Year
[Place of Birth] Columbia
[Date of Birth] Aug 13
[Race] Liberi
[Height] 150cm
[Infection Status] 
Confirmed infected by medical examination.

[Physical Strength] Standard
[Mobility] Excellent
[Physical Resilience] Standard
[Tactical Acumen] Normal
[Combat Skill] Standard
[Originium Arts Assimilation] Standard

A street girl of Columbia, born to a normal working-class family. Her parents are both truck drivers and often work through the night, pushing Aciddrop out to the streets at a young age. From practicing skateboarding in her spare time after school to becoming a champion at local skateboarding tournaments, Aciddrop has become a renowned street icon throughout the city, and her success has drawn countless haters in the process. During a deliberate fight, Aciddrop was infected with Originium dust, later coming to Rhodes Island to seek treatment.

Imaging tests have shown the outlines of her internal organs to be indistinct due to abnormal shadows. Originium granules have been detected in her circulatory system, confirming her to be infected with Oripathy. 

[Cell-Originium Assimilation] 4%
Operator Aciddrop's Oripathy is currently still mild, and no Originium crystals have been found on the surface of the body. 

[Blood Originium-Crystal Density] 0.15u/L
Aciddrop was infected as the product of manmade accident. Fortunately, the amount of Originium dust she inhaled was minute and the infection is being handled appropriately. No trend of deterioration present.

Miss Aciddrop is an extremely 'hip' girl. This is not solely due to her interest in skateboarding, graffiti, and rap, but also due to her strong temperament. This is reflected through her open-minded attitude towards all things in life— even when undergoing a series of examinations for her Oripathy, Miss Aciddrop would only lament that she had to postpone her cycling trip, as if her free-spirited travels were of greater importance than her condition. 
By the way, Miss Aciddrop is not 'interested' in street culture. According to her own account, she was actually quite famous in her hometown prior to becoming infected: she had won many local skating competitions, children all wanted to learn how to skate from her, and she shared sibling-like bonds with some of the street artists there. —Though I first thought this was simply the boasting of a street girl, we discovered that a certain line of a famous, trendy sports brand really had plans to feature her as a model. This certainly surprised us.

During her operator assessment exam, Miss Aciddrop demonstrated an unexpected talent for sniping— strictly speaking, a very flashy talent. Though the mobility granted from being able to shoot while on a skateboard is of dubious value in actual combat, this Liberi's agility caught many operators off guard. 'It's like she's performing for a crowd,' one operator from the HR Department remarked. 
However, let this not overshadow the fact that Miss Aciddrop's proficiency with a hand crossbow is not inferior to her skill on the skateboard. It is said that she learned these skills from an old local policeman. As a student, Aciddrop was report to the police for 'excessive graffiti,' and was chased around three blocks by an old, seemingly-weak policeman. Afterwards, she was subjected to a scolding that was dozens of minutes long. After such incidents 'accidentally occurred several more times,' scolding soon turned into chatter, and the kindhearted old policeman seemed to take pity upon Aciddrop, for her parents were almost never home, leaving her to fend for herself. Intentionally or otherwise, the old policeman let his daughter become friends with Aciddrop, since the two of them were the same age. It is this daughter who first taught Aciddrop how to skate. 
'Of course, the pupil surpassed the teacher, eh?' Miss Aciddrop would happily proclaim.

Aciddrop's hometown is located in a rather remote location in Columbia. The vast land and undeveloped economy there were rich breeding grounds for the gray market to flourish. The Siracusan Mafia, local gangs, and large merchants frequently made their way in and out, and though this shady area was kept relatively orderly, the general public security is far from ideal. In order to give the young and energetic children a means to protect themselves, after hesitating again and again, the old policeman taught Aciddrop the basic techniques to operate a hand crossbow, and also made a simple weapon for her— after all, he believed that Aciddrop has a strong sense of justice and was not the kind of child who would do bad things with a weapon. 
Unfortunately, there were some issues with Aciddrop's loose definition of justice. During an unexpected auto accident, the brave Aciddrop unintentionally destroyed a gang's illegal Originium trading plan, triggering retaliation from the affected gang members. During a brawl that was disguised as a case of school bullying, gang members who were even younger than Aciddrop sprinkled Originium dust onto her.

However, Aciddrop is not one to dwell on the past, demonstrating the perseverance and strength that her youth affords her. This perseverance has supported her to face the painful aspects of life, or in other words, allowed her to take her mind off from the pain. Perhaps one day, after Miss Aciddrop's Originium is effectively suppressed, she will choose to return home. Even if she can no longer take off her identity as an Infected, she feels as if she must complete the journey she failed to finish. 
'A toast to freedom, a toast to onion rings, and a toast to myself.' —Excerpt from a speech made by Miss Aciddrop on her first day at the dorms, when she threw a cocktail party using carbonated drinks rather than liquor.

Recently... There have been some bizarre rumors aboard Rhodes Island. As we are fairly tolerant of various cultures, pop culture among the youth is, of course, rather interesting. However, due to invisible individuals playing super loud hip-hop, graffiti appearing out of thin air, and a skateboarding trend that has spread like wildfire across younger operators and patients alike... If possible, shouldn't we try to dial things down a bit? What do you all think? —The 'suggestion' of a highly-respected logistics operator to young operators such as Ethan, Aciddrop, and Vigna

However, after refugees were rescued from the ruins of a Catastrophe area, you all tagged 'Never say die' on the walls of the ruins. I can't say I'm not a fan. —A subsequent word of appreciation added by the respected logistics operator

[Code Name] Tomimi
[Gender] Female
[Combat Experience] None
[Place of Birth] Sargon
[Date of Birth] Feb 2
[Race] Archosauria
[Height] 142cm
[Infection Status] 
Medical tests have confirmed that no infection is present.

[Physical Strength] Excellent
[Mobility] Normal
[Physical Resilience] Standard
[Tactical Acumen] Standard
[Combat Skill] Standard
[Originium Arts Assimilation] Standard

Tomimi, an Archosauria from the Acahualla region of Sargon, is a friend and supporter to Gavial. She tried all sorts of radical ways to prevent Gavial from returning to Rhodes Island, but upon her failure, instead accompanied Gavial back to Rhodes Island.
She assumes the responsibilities of a Caster but often forgets that she is a Caster. Nevertheless, given her excellent performance on the battlefield, there are no plans to have her switch operator roles.

Imaging tests reveal clear, normal outlines of internal organs, and no abnormal shadows have been detected. Originium granules have not been detected in the circulatory system and there is no sign of infection. At this time, this operator is believed to be uninfected. 

[Cell-Originium Assimilation] 0%
'This one's the exact same as before, pure and unblemished.' 

[Blood Originium-Crystal Density] 0.14u/L
'Is she actually listening to me when I say she needs to exercise? Not bad.' 

'I pretty much already know everything about Tomimi—— Though this would be the first time I gave her a physical exam.' ——Gavial
'The physical exam went smoothly, but her heartbeat was abnormally fast and that confounded the data.' ——Gavial

After Gavial saw through her 'trick' and 'punished' her, Tomimi decided to follow Gavial to Rhodes Island and become an operator. Tomimi has little knowledge of life outside her tribe. Her impressions of the outside world come entirely from her conversation with Inam and from the books that were commissioned. When she first came to Rhodes Island, she was the same as two other operators, making a variety of common sense blunders during her trial-and-error phase. However, she quickly completed her transition thanks to her adaptability, and transformed from the leader of a small tribe on the border of Sargon into a Caster Operator with a unique personal flair. 
When Tomimi first applied to become an operator, some of the other operators in charge of the testing process initially were opposed to letting her become a Caster. In the eyes of Casters who have been trained under the theoretical framework of modern Originium Arts, Tomimi's use of Originium Arts is brutish and backwards, particularly her preference towards melee combat which runs contrary to what is typically required of Casters. When the testers gathered around to discuss their opinions, one interesting question was front and foremost:
'What's the difference between her and Gavial?' 
'Gavial wouldn't actually force people.' 
'I think that's only because she's too busy.' 
'But ultimately, they decided to let Tomimi become a Caster, and in terms of her training policy, they did not ask her to conform to the standards of modern Casters and instead allowed her to implement her own fighting style. The reason is, after observing Tomimi's fighting style, they determined that there was some value in studying it. 'Injecting' your own Arts into a wand in order to fill it with lethal power is, from a certain perspective, an utterly fanciful notion. Casters themselves tend to be intellectually curious people as well. After acknowledging Tomimi's combat abilities, a small group of Casters adopted the belief that 'Casters ought to be physically strong.' They even began to hope that a new school of Originium Arts would form through Tomimi's growth— Of course, even if this was to succeed, that'll be some time in the future.

When talking to Tomimi, there is always one topic that cannot be avoided: Gavial. As soon as this name is mentioned, the normally taciturn Tomimi will instantly open her inner chatterbox, praising Gavial's goodness as if her life depended on her. This degree of enthusiasm may be a match for that of the fans stuck outside the gates of Monster Siren Records HQ waiting for a chance to meet their idols. If you put yourself in her shoes though, Tomimi becoming like this may have been inevitable. Pretend that there's a beautiful young girl. Outside, she's the queen of the playground, and not even the adults can handle her. Everyone wants to be her friend, but she's always at your doorstep, sharing meals with you and asking you to play, showering you with her geniality and grace— What kind of person wouldn't be moved?! Furthermore, this wonderful young girl was stabbed by Originium in the mines in order to protect Tomimi, and ended up contracting Oripathy because of it. Even the bestselling authors of Columbia dare not write such heart-wrenching passages lightly, but this is not a work of fiction. It is Tomimi's truth, and that is why she is so devoted to Gavial. After that, Tomimi dedicated herself to attending Gavial, though the latter mistook this as 'exclusion.' After violently beating down all challengers at the Mahuizzotia, Gavial left the tribe. As for what happened afterwards, please refer to the reports from relevant individuals following Gavial's return from her hometown in Sargon. According to the report summary, the reason why Tomimi thought of using a rocket launcher to shoot down the Doctor's aircraft may simply have been because she hadn't seen Gavial in a long time, nothing more. Tomimi has not pulled any crazy stunts like this since coming to Rhodes Island with Gavial. 

'My word, is there really no need to publish a book on Tomimi's antics? A movie would do fine too. They'd be smash hits for sure.' 
'Keep going on about that, if you want Gavial to smack you.' 
'Don't worry, the relevant parties are... a bit slow.' 
'......'
'Um, in that case, I'll be counting on you for the script for the annual festival.' 
'Change things up a little bit though. We'll get beaten up if they recognize themselves!' 
'You got it. Just leave it to me. '

After returning to Rhodes Island, the Doctor asked Tomimi how she had come up with all those terrible ideas. After waffling around for quite some time, Tomimi brought out a number of books that had titles such as these:
'Only One Step Until The New You', 'You're a Winner', 'Learn Business Management in 100 Days'...
Then, she took out a list of books that often appeared on the bestseller lists of bookstores, mostly related to fashion, self-help, and management. Without a doubt, the contents of these books gave Tomimi some dubious directions when it came to her understanding of the real world. For example... she really tried to apply this corporate management system to the members of the 'Gavial's Will' tribe, demanding that everyone wear a uniform, shout slogans, and fight like a Lupo (note that she had no idea what a Lupo was prior to joining Rhodes Island). Though the tribe had no complaints due to Tomimi's abilities, after she left, everyone in the tribe quickly lapsed into their old, comfortable ways. With this in mind, the rocket launcher incident was probably inspired by one of these books. 
Fortunately, Tomimi was able to pick up a number of practical life skills. She is already familiar with storing items in a limited space, an ability that has earned her the praise of dorm staff. In addition, she is proficient in the use of expedition tools, able to explore the wilds without assistance. Nor will she ever again make the mistake of getting trapped in a mine by accident and putting herself in danger. However, Rhodes Island is different from the hometown of her Acahualla tribe. Gone is the near-infinite space she had back there to store her various collectibles. Under Gavial's persuasion, she has begun to screen her treasures, keeping only the most valuable things in a backpack that she carries on her person. 
All things considered, one cannot say that Tomimi is unintelligent, but rather, all her energy goes into the wrong areas.

Tomimi's tail grew again. 
By itself, this is not a bad thing, as the Archosaurus people are proud of having large tails. 
But Tomimi's tail doesn't only grow longer, it also grows thicker. 
As for the proper ideal of what a tail should be like, the Archosaurs themselves have not reached a consensus. The dispute betwen 'thick tails' and 'fine tails' still continues to this day. 
Tomimi isn't invested in this issue and is perfectly fine with whatever size or length tail she may have, and Gavial is also in agreement. 
Nevertheless, her tail is a bit heavy, and sometimes causes inconveniences in day-to-day life. Upon the Doctor's recommendation, Tomimi finally decided to use a tail clamp made especially for Archosaurus use. 
People often hear Tomimi lamenting: 'When I was little, my tail was the same thickness as Gavial's. Why'd it end up growing so much more?' 
Tomimi couldn't decide whether to keep her tail as it is or to grit her teeth and trim down on it. 
On one hand, a thick tail is quite popular and can even bring some unexpected benefits on the battlefield. As a bonus, Gavial likes to squeeze it. 
On the other hand, this tail sometimes poses inconveniences to others, and it may be difficult to find good-looking outfits that can accommodate such a large tail. 
As a result, this question had been bothering Tomimi for a long time. 
She needed someone to help her make the decision and implement her choice. 
Who do you think that person was?

A (partial) list of items in the backpack Tomimi made for herself:

A piece of amber wrapped in leaves.
'A neat thing I found on my first expedition. Holding it right now makes me happy.' 

A fired clay wad, slightly deformed 
'The first time Gavial and I tried to make pottery. She squeezed it a bit too hard and it got a bit deformed.' 

A fang that fell out when I was growing
'Mama always said this was my lucky tooth, so I've always kept it in my bag.' 

The woven bag I kept my collectibles in when I was younger
'It's really sturdy and can still last a really long time!' 

Gavial's signature, cut out from various places (erasure marks visible)
'...I want more.' 

Doctor's badge
'Doctor gave this to me. I can become smarter if I keep it with me.' 

A stack of dreamcatchers
'To give to people who can't sleep well.' 

'Praise the Sun'
'A really interesting book. I'll read a bit more tonight.' 

Adventure package
'Has all sorts of neat stuff inside it, very useful for when adventuring.' 

Field medic kit
'Still learning how to use it. After that, I'll be able to help Gavial whenever she needs it.' 

A black (erasure marks) rock (erasure marks)
(Heavy erasure marks) Gavial's
(More erasure marks)
......
(The following is omitted)

avgList.storyIntro: Can you be both hedonistic and head-over-heels in longing?

stories.storyText:
[Code Name] Flint
[Gender] Female
[Combat Experience] 15 years (Self-reported)
[Place of Birth] Sargon
[Date of Birth] Sept 17th
[Race] Liberi
[Height] 144cm
[Infection Status] 
Medical tests have confirmed that no infection is present.

[Physical Strength] Standard 
[Mobility] Excellent
[Physical Resilience] Normal 
[Tactical Acumen] Normal 
[Combat Skill] Standard 
[Originium Arts Assimilation] Normal

Flint, Sargon tribal warrior, began building her combat experience from the moment she was first able to put up her fists. She has mastered a martial arts style based on swift and precise punches. 
She is currently here on the recommendation of a certain elite operator whose identity has been withheld, and became a Rhodes Island Guard Operator after passing the examination.

Imaging tests reveal clear, normal outlines of internal organs, and no abnormal shadows have been detected. Originium granules have not been detected in the circulatory system and there is no sign of infection. At this time, this operator is believed to be uninfected. 

[Cell-Originium Assimilation] 0%
Operator Flint shows no signs of Originium infection. 

[Blood Originium-Crystal Density] 0.05u/L
Operator Flint rarely comes into contact with Originium. She might not even know what Originium is in the first place. 

What am I supposed to be looking for? She's the picture of health! 
—Gavial

The one Blaze brought back with her went and picked another fight with an Operator in the training center today. 
To preface, Rhodes Island has built up a healthy collection of operators, each different in their own ways, with no shortage of misfits among them. There have been plenty of times where a single flippant comment made someone throw down right in the corridor. Sorting out all those scuffles is a pain, but the fact that they happen in the first place doesn't really surprise anyone. Operator Flint's case, however, is somewhat distinct from this. 
We've had a lot of operators who've 'compared notes' on physical combat with Flint testify that actually, the fights that unfolded between them were with both sides' mutual discretion and consent. No bad blood at play, no clash that sparked a conflict. In most situations, this short girl stares straight at her target, walks over to them, opens her mouth, and lets loose some strange syllabic utterances. The two then recognize something implicit in the other's gaze, and then put up their dukes. 
'I didn't understand what she was saying. But there was no wickedness in her eyes.' -The words of Operator Broca.

Prior to arriving at Rhodes Island, Operator Flint was completely unable to speak several common languages. According to Flint, the common tongues were much like the native languages that evolved freely in the unregulated lands of Sargon, making it almost impossible for her to keep track of. Thus, following her arrival at Rhodes Island, studying common languages has become an important part of her schedule in order to facilitate smooth communication in day-to-day life. 
The common languages are not particularly difficult to learn, and a persuasive word from Gavial to Flint about taking daily language courses proved to be key. 
'What, don't you wanna be able to chat up Blaze?'
That was all it took. It worked better than anything anyone else had to say, and Flint began to study seriously. 

[Voice Log]
'So what do we do until she learns? There's nobody else around who can make sense of her native dialect. Do we just wave our hands at her?' 
'Oh. Don't you worry about that.'
'What's not to worry about?! Missions! What do we do about missions? Okay, do we use body language to give her orders in the middle of the battlefield, too?'
'Relax, relax. All accounted for when they put the squad together, don't you worry. See, the Doctor's already kinda sorta picked up a little bit of that weird Sargon blah-blah whatever it is!'

Operator Flint is a Liberi who was raised in the rainforest. The tribe of Liberi she comes from is naturally of small stature, and it's apparent that their physical fitness compared to other Liberi falls slightly short. One need not even start comparing them to the wealth of combative, healthily robust races surrounding them. This is why Flint's tribe has always had a relatively tough time living in the rainforest. These challenges persisted up until Flint reached the age where she could run and jump, at which point she promptly picked and won a fight with two Archosauria who substantially outclassed her. She beat them on their own ground. 
Flint's fists are fast and tricky. Where she falls short in terms of naturally endowed strength, her race's superiority in speed makes up handily for the deficiency. Her fighting style differs from any boxer with a grounding in theory. She wields her fists to knock her opponent down, pure and simple, and they carry an almost illusory sense of the freedom and danger of the rainforest. 
As the tallest and strongest warrior in her tribe, Flint was always quite confident of her own build, even proud of it, until she came into contact with other, much taller peoples. Once she came to the realization that most of the entire outside world's population was of much greater stature than her, Flint was quick to give up her arrogance born of ignorance, and she began seeking out new challenges. She went to find those stronger than herself, challenge them, harden and mold herself, improve herself, until she could beat them. 
Do not underestimate her for her size. No Sargon warrior ever feared a challenge. 

[Addendum by file author]
I will refrain from putting her relationship with the taller operators into words. On the other hand, she gets along with our operators of Durin origin. No question about that.

One might expect that in their reverence for might and strength, the Tiacauh would be impulsive and unruly. But we must admit their conduct is full of great fervor, candor and a masterful valor. Operator Flint is an archetypal example of this. 
As Flint sees it, there is nothing that can't be settled with her fists some way or another. Back in Flint's old stomping grounds, you'd often catch a glimpse of Tiacauh people who'd been wrestling with each other just a moment ago, who'd stood themselves up straight, shook hands and made peace with each other the very next second. After that handshake, they might wrap their arms around each other's shoulders and go off to eat together. Though, generally, they'll get into another fight because of something else altogether before they can sit down. 
In addition, the Liberi people to which Flint belongs have a love for flowers that far exceeds the norm. Their preference is especially for lushly colored specimens, which can be often found adorning their homes. Operator Flint holds the fundamental notion that flowers are something found everywhere, and freely pickable as one wishes. Even now, living in Rhodes Island's colossus of rebar and iron sheeting, she continues to think so. 
As Miss Perfumer's greenhouse steadily drew in the horticulture enthusiasts one after another, a great mystery reared its head. Flowers would often be picked without warning. As the days went on, the gardeners whose plants went missing ultimately formed an alliance, agreeing once and for all to teach the delinquent flower-picker a lesson they'd never forget. 
Before they set out a real action plan, Operator Flamebringer's meticulously cultivated bonsai was burgled overnight—a crucial breakthrough. The concerned parties fought each other bitterly that next day, and finally, under the oppressive gaze of Dr. Gavial, they reluctantly shook hands and made their own peace. 

At least Operator Flint now understands. Unlike the rainforest, abundant with vegetation, she should refrain from picking the flowers she finds growing within Rhodes Island. The greenhouse's keeper has allowed Flint the use of a small flowerbed. You can find the Tiacauh stooping next to it from time to time, her hands, so often closed in fists, carefully pulling the weeds, looking forward to seeing the flowers bloom.

To Flint, most people think too much and wind themselves up too tight. Especially the people of Rhodes Island, some of them propping themselves up while they keep working. They make so little sense to her. 
'If you're tired, go take a break!'
So she says. And when she says it, warrior that she is, she's usually already prepared to safeguard you from any danger as you rest.

Only, you worry how the warrior of the rainforest hasn't yet fully grasped just how vast, and broad, this world is. She still needs more time to understand this. Just how much in this world can be solved with her fists alone, and just how many things we're powerless to do anything about.

avgList.storyIntro: If your fists still aren't big enough, you need to grab hold of some other way to solve problems.

stories.storyText:
[Code Name] Eunectes
[Gender] Female
[Combat Experience] None
[Place of Birth] Sargon
[Date of Birth] Oct 30
[Race] Pythia
[Height] 171cm
[Infection Status]
Confirmed Infected by medical examination.

[Physical Strength] Excellent 
[Mobility] Standard 
[Physical Resilience] Excellent 
[Tactical Acumen] Normal 
[Combat Skill] Standard 
[Originium Arts Assimilation] Standard

The leader of a certain tribe that resides in Acahualla—Gavial's hometown. She was admitted into Rhodes Island after passing the operator examination and began receiving treatment at the same time. 
Her physical qualities are no less impressive than Gavial's. Currently active in the battlefields with her trusted companion, the Raging Ironhide.

Imaging tests have shown the outlines of her internal organs to be indistinct due to abnormal shadows. Originium granules have been detected in her circulatory system, confirming her to be infected with Oripathy. 

[Cell-Originium Assimilation] 7%
Small traces of infection are visible on the surface of the body. 

[Blood Originium-Crystal Density] 0.22u/L
Operator Eunectes was infected at a relatively early age, and her condition is somewhat severe as it was never really kept in check. However, thanks to her excellent physical condition, the spread of the disease in her body has slowed down by a considerable degree, and it has further stabilized after receiving treatment. Further observation and regular treatment are required. 

Well, look what we have here! Your body's pretty well built! 
—Gavial

Eunectes is a Pythian girl whose interests can be described as somewhat peculiar. 
She isn't the type to actively raise conversations, nor is she the kind of person to keep quiet to herself. In many ways, her views and ideologies are much more normal compared to Gavial, who'd left home years ago, but she can be pretty stubborn when it comes to all matters machinery-related. 
When she first joined Rhodes Island, for a period of time, she opted to use her real name, 'Zumama', as her codename just as Tomimi before her did. However, when Closure christened the newly rebuilt Big Ugly 'the Raging Ironhide', she took the opportunity to give herself a new codename based on her tribe's name—'Eunectes.' 
That being said, a sizable number of our operators, such as Gavial, still call her by her name. 
Based on her own personal account, she rarely ever picks fights with anyone, her frequent bouts with Gavial during their childhoods notwithstanding. As such, this will not be accounted for in her combat experience evaluation.

According to Eunectes's own personal account, her knowledge of anything not related to her tribe can be attributed entirely to her book collection. 
This explains how even though she was able to hit it off with Closure the moment she joined the Engineering Department—though just as quickly, she made Closure so mad that she threw the bag of chips in her hands—her common sense and knowledge about our day-to-day lives are peculiar to say the least. 
Nonetheless, how she was able to pick up foreign languages and robotics just by flipping through a few books goes to show her learning ability is remarkable. 
Not long after joining Rhodes Island, she further demonstrated this impressive ability: after just a few months, Closure personally approved her request to be assigned to the Engineering Department. 
Sadly, even though she was able to learn how to operate all sorts of machinery in no time, to this day she has shown no noticeable improvement when it comes to life outside her tribe.

After Eunectes joined Rhodes Island, she has become somewhat of a laughingstock thanks to her lack of understanding regarding anything she's unfamiliar with, and the funniest thing about her has to be her relationship with Lancet-2. 
The sight of Eunectes calling Lancet-2 her sister never fails to catch operators oblivious to this relationship by surprise. Of course, Lancet-2 is fairly popular amongst operators thanks to her personality, but Eunectes's passion for her is on another level. 
It isn't hard to fathom why, of course. 
Most of us have probably been so awestruck by something we've never so much as heard of that it sent chills down our spines at some point in our lives. The kind of moment that feels as though you flung open a whole new door, like discovering new untrodden lands. To Eunectes, that moment came as a child when she witnessed a nomadic city just passing through by chance. The gigantic machine, colored in its icy machinery colors, struck her with amazement like never before. That moment came again when she first heard Lancet-2 talk. This time, it was the possibilities that robotics has that struck her with amazement. 
Wouldn't most operators be just as surprised when they first come across operations platforms that talk? The difference here is that most operators aren't all that interested in robots and therefore don't react the same way Eunectes does. 
On the other hand, while Eunectes shows extraordinary respect to other operations platforms as well, Lancet-2 is particularly dear to her. This is actually a glimpse of her normalcy. 
Her special treatment for Lancet-2 can be described as ritualistic and as a sort of emotional sustenance. This is a beacon she picked for herself in her new life, and it can even be seen as the manifestation of what she has always dreamt of achieving herself. 
Which is why, even though she's the developer of all the operations platforms and the person that Eunectes has come to look up to as her master, Closure has never tried to put a stop to her so-called stupid apprentice's behavior. She probably knows exactly how Eunectes feels.

Although the Doctor's trip to Acahualla had a happy, almost comedic ending, there is still a point worthy of discussion. 
Even though Eunectes's true goal has always been to build gigantic robots and nothing more, had this series of events not transpired, she would have become the Great Chieftain, and under her rule, the Acahuallan tribes would likely advance into a strange but nonetheless robotic era. By its very essence, it's an idea that runs against their traditions—a breakthrough. 
From this point of view, you could say Gavial was the manifestation of tradition itself. She believed in her own strength and didn't seek any outside help. Having abided by this principle for years, this has become one of the most iconic examples of Acahuallan tradition.
In other words, by its very essence, this series of events can be seen as a conflict between traditions and breakthroughs. If it wasn't for Gavial's relationship with Eunectes, if it wasn't for the region's lax sense of tradition to begin with, and how modest the Acahuallan people were, history tells us all this would have ended very badly. 
Of course, that is simply conjecture, and this isn't to say that we were lucky things turned out the way they did. Rather, I wanted to pose an interesting question:
If Gavial and Eunectes each represented a different lifestyle—Gavial's being the primitive yet free lifestyle while Eunectes represented a more orderly lifestyle that relied upon tools—would we be able to say for sure that one is more correct and would lead to a better life? 
To take this question one step further, what makes a good lifestyle? 
There isn't a single correct answer to this question, but if you look at how Gavial and Eunectes are such polar opposites yet alike in some ways, I believe this would be an interesting question to ponder.

Eunectes's partner isn't actually the unit that the Doctor's team encountered in the rainforest. That unit was called 'The Big Ugly Thing.' 
With its enormous size, the Big Ugly wouldn't have fit in our aircrafts, and it ended up being destroyed anyway. As such, we only brought with us a small number of its spare parts on the way back. 
The unit we have now is a brand new unit that the whole Engineering Department worked together to rebuild. The Chief Engineer named it 'the Raging Ironhide.' 
On the outside, this new unit isn't all that different from its predecessor. Inside, however, it couldn't be more different from the haphazardly put-together Big Ugly. It was the fruit of the whole Engineering Department putting their heads together. And supposedly, Eunectes broke down in tears at the workshop when it was finally completed.
To her, it was probably the most concrete step she has ever taken to make her dream a reality. 
Aside from this, after the Raging Ironhide was completed, the High Priest, who Eunectes has occasionally mentioned as the Big Ugly's pilot, has started popping up frequently here in Rhodes Island. Dr. Kal'tsit has told the operators to pay it no mind. That kind of bothered me at first, but thanks to the High Priest's happy-go-lucky personality, it didn't take long for everyone to get used to having it around.

[Code Name] Arene
[Gender] Male]
[Combat Experience] Six months
[Place of Birth] Laterano
[Date of Birth] September 7
[Race] Sankta
[Height] 161cm
[Infection Status] 
Crystals have appeared on his body. Infection confirmed by medical examination.

[Physical Strength] Normal
[Mobility] Normal
[Physical Resilience] Normal
[Tactical Acumen] Excellent
[Combat Skill] Normal
[Originium Arts Assimilation] Excellent

Operator Arene is a Laterano-born Sankta who was exiled from Laterano after contracting Oripathy during a Laterano firearm inheritance-related incident several years ago. After he departed Laterano, he left for Leithanien to pursue further studies. 
Having passed a battery of examinations, he is currently serving as a Rhodes Island Vanguard Operator and receiving treatment.

Imaging tests have shown the outlines of his internal organs to be indistinct due to abnormal shadows. Originium granules have been detected in his circulatory system, confirming him to be infected with Oripathy. 

[Cell-Originium Assimilation] 5%
Small traces of infection are visible on the surface of the body. 

[Blood Originium-Crystal Density] 0.23u/L
Operator Arene has been receiving Oripathy-related treatment for a long time. As a result, his infection is well under control, with no trend of deterioration.

There are many regulations in Laterano law that lay out strict, detailed stipulations for how to care for citizens who contract Oripathy in many possible scenarios. 
When a Laterano citizen contracts Oripathy, he or she continues to enjoy all of the rights guaranteed to them as part of their citizenship. However, aside from a few special cases, they are typically not allowed to remain in Laterano territory. Compared to the strict regulations many other countries and territories have for the Infected, you could say that only getting exiled from Laterano is far more lenient. That being the case, if you become Infected in Laterano, you must forever leave your homeland, never again to set foot on the place you grew up. To many Lateranos, this is understandably an unbearable proposition. 
On his own initiative, operator Arene studied in Leithanien for years after contracting Oripathy. Consequently, the hometown that he can no longer return to may very well have become nothing but a faint memory to him long ago.

Most people tend to have a rather ingrained impression of the Sankta. To them, the Sankta and their guns are inseparable concepts, and the Sankta, with their halos above their heads, are never ones to part with their precious firearms. And whenever a Sankta is unable to keep a gun due to whatever extraordinary circumstance, they would usually choose the next best thing they are allowed: long-ranged weapons like bows. 
In most cases, one would be correct to make such assumptions. That being said, there are some occasional exceptions to the norm. Operator Arene is one such exception at Rhodes Island. He is one of the few Sankta here to forgo the use of firearms, instead opting to use Originium Arts as his primary means of attack. 
The Originium Arts that Operator Arene utilizes are somewhat unusual: his Arts tend to be have toxic, disintegrative, and corrosive traits. As a result, he normally keeps away from crowds in order to mitigate any unnecessary risks. And just like the impression that others typically have of Operator Arene himself, his Originium Arts typically strike others as beautiful yet dangerous, amicable yet seclusive, and requiring extra care to approach. 
Due to his frequent use of Arts, Arene himself usually carries a faint aromatic fragrance. The fragrance's effect on others is alterable at will, and can either be rendered completely harmless or made dangerously toxic during the most crucial situations.

When Operator Arene first arrived at Rhodes Island, he was accompanied by a Notarial Hall executor. 
According to this chaperone of his, a colleague of Operator Executor's, both of Arene's parents were highly respected Laterano firearms researchers, and the two of them were frequently dragged into all kinds of Laterano firearm-related incidents thanks to their profession. It is precisely for this reason that, when Arene contracted Oripathy several years ago, his parents opted to send him, their one and only son, away from danger to Leithanien instead of keeping him close by. 
Regretfully, both of his parents were killed during a recent clandestine operation to steal Laterano firearms technology. Their will unfortunately brought Arene plenty of trouble as well—most people seem to believe that a parent would always leave every last thing they treasured to their children. In reality, the only thing that Arene's parents ever wished for was for their only son to live a peaceful life. They knew their research would undoubtedly be taken up by Laterano departments far more up to the task than him. 
Even though the crisis has mostly been averted thanks to Operator Arene's master plan, there still remains enough of a risk that, in spite of the young man's temperament, the poor executor had to escort Arene to Rhodes Island to seek his colleague's help, before taking a temporary leave to deal with some so-called problematic follow-up work. 
During his childhood, Arene's parents were often preoccupied with work and had little time to spend with their son, leaving him alone at home most of his childhood. Young children often have a hard time understanding their parents' passion for work. To the young Arene, it was guns that had stolen his parents' attention from him, and that became the source of his apathy against guns, normally admired by Sankta children far and wide. Furthermore, after his infection during the accident, he lost any opportunity to have his own gun. 
Perhaps because he departed Laterano at an early age, Arene tends to be a little sheepish around some of our other Laterano operators. Instead, he is more proactive in interacting with our Leithanian operators. One such example is Operator Eyjafjalla. The two of them had studied under the same famous professor at their university, just barely enough to make them old classmates.

When Arene first joined our ranks, it didn't take long for us to notice his completely nonchalant attitude and lack of restraint, likely a result of the environment he grew up in. 
At first, none of us thought this was a problem. After all, we have operators with all kinds of personalities here at Rhodes Island, even some particularly freewheeling Sarkaz mercenaries that we had to reluctantly learn to tolerate. Compared to them, the young boy's tendency to play pranks on operators or his mildly sadistic attitude toward his enemies were hardly issues at all. 
However, when Arene brought an enemy combatant back with him after an operation and then half-jokingly suggested practicing new Originium Arts on him, it became obvious to us that it was perhaps not a good idea to afford our still-growing adolescent operators total, unrestricted freedom. Operator Arene should no longer be allowed to do whatever he pleases. The young, sensitive Sankta is in dire need of proper guidance and instruction that, cruicially, do not bore him.

The young man refers to you as his professor. 
Both you and him should be well aware that he didn't actually mean it at first. 
But what about now? 
Perhaps you could actually teach him something. He is still learning, and he needs someone to guide him to the path he is to take.

[Code Name] April
[Gender] Female
[Combat Experience] None
[Place of Birth] Rim Billiton
[Date of Birth] January 27
[Race] Cautus
[Height] 157cm
[Infection Status] 
Originium crystals are present on the body's surface, confirmed Infected by medical examination.

[Physical Strength] Standard
[Mobility] Standard
[Physical Resilience] Standard
[Tactical Acumen] Standard
[Combat Skill] Standard
[Originium Arts Assimilation] Standard

A hunter from Rim Billiton, lost her job due to Oripathy before making her way to Rhodes Island. 
Has never received formal training. All indicators read average. Her previous occupation suggested an affinity for sniper training, and she currently serves as a Sniper Operator.

Imaging tests have shown the outlines of her internal organs to be indistinct due to abnormal shadows. Originium granules have been detected in her circulatory system, confirming her to be infected with Oripathy. 

 [Cell-Originium Assimilation] 5%
Some mild crystallization visible on her back. 

 [Blood Originium-Crystal Density] 0.17u/L
The Operator reports she avoided dangerous environments with significant Originium exposure risk, but living in such poor conditions for so long ultimately caused her infection to worsen.

She has a real urban feel to her, always going around with her stereo playing.
Very extroverted, she gets along with everyone. 
She is always looking to improve her lot in life, and follows trends closely. She is often seen chatting with Utage and Orchid.

Because of the highly developed mining industry in Rim Billiton, the population is more likely to be exposed to Originium than in other countries. So most Rim Billiton companies have some kind of benefits structure for employees who get infected on the job to encourage them to work without fear. 
But April's experience shows that not every company does provide such benefits. Or maybe because of a general revulsion for Infected people, the lower level functionaries of these companies may not have an interest in caring for them, no matter what policies the upper management may put in place to keep people working.
Whether April was forced out of Rim Billiton because her benefits weren't worth the paper they were printed on, or because a bad actor worked against her, we can't know. And it's clear she hasn't investigated it herself. Of course, it doesn't really matter, in the end. Even if it is the latter, it wouldn't be easy for April to go recover what is owed her, considering the situation of the Infected.

If Rhodes Island held an interior decorating competition (we won't), then April would likely take the prize. 
Rhodes Island dormitories have a very plain design, serving only to provide occupants with a basic standard of living. Most operators have no further interest in design. But the company does not have any regulations against operators making interior modifications, as long as they don't damage the landship. In fact, Rhodes Island encourages them to do just that, in hopes of improving their lives. So while most operators live in very plain surroundings, there are some with a lot of character, and April's are among the best. 
Her room is exquisitely decorated. Posters, knick knacks, flower pots, and such all give the place a lively atmosphere, well-suited to her personality. We're very glad to see her adapting to and even loving life at Rhodes Island.

There is a common misconception that once someone becomes Infected, they will then speak for the Infected, and always side with the Infected. 
The truth is obviously different. Sudden changes are always difficult to accept. One who does try to accept such changes should be commended for her open-mindedness. But we shouldn't condemn someone for failing to accept the drastic, sudden change that is Oripathy infection.
Not everyone would openly accept her identity as an Infected person, and every new Rhodes Island operator will receive psychological counseling about that identity to avoid excessive burdens and conflicts over the course of her work. 
This is of particular concern for operators who come from civilian backgrounds like April, for whom discrimination against the Infected is deeply rooted. We must acknowledge the reality that some people, completely without malice, grow up in an environment that teaches them to dehumanize the Infected. And that these people, even if they become Infected themselves, do not see the Infected as peers. It is difficult to reverse that perception. 
Luckily, April's cheerful disposition and open-minded personality did her well. While she had some ingrained discrimination against the Infected and some resultant self-loathing, she quickly shed these ideas thanks to our counseling and the general environment of life in Rhodes Island. She immediately began to think about how she could help others who also suffered like her. While she may not be that impressive in combat, April's outlook and thinking are worthy of emulation.

avgList.storyIntro: Whether one loves or hates others—a question she ultimately elects not to ask.

stories.storyText:
[Code Name] Mint
[Gender] Female
[Combat Experience] None
[Place of Birth] Victoria
[Date of Birth] February 5
[Race] Feline
[Height] 155cm
[Infection Status]
Originium crystals distributed across the surface of her body, confirmed Infected by medical examination.

[Physical Strength] Normal
[Mobility] Normal
[Physical Resilience] Normal
[Tactical Acumen] Standard
[Combat Skill] Normal
[Originium Arts Assimilation] Excellent

Mint is a Caster affiliated with the Victorian Institution for Higher Studies, specializing in geology, frequently participating in investigative field projects. She contracted Oripathy on an expedition and was referred by Operator Skyfire to Rhodes Island for consultation. 
She currently receives treatment at Rhodes Island while assisting with Originium research, environmental and geological observation, and related services.

Imaging tests have shown the outlines of her internal organs to be indistinct due to abnormal shadows. Originium granules have been detected in her circulatory system, confirming her to be infected with Oripathy. 

[Cell-Originium Assimilation] 4%
Small traces of infection visible on surface of body. Severity of condition is mild and notably stable. 

[Blood Originium-Crystal Density] 0.17u/L
Operator Mint often works deep within danger zones. Despite strict safety measures, risk of aggravation remains present. We recommend she receives regular checkups.

With her backgroundin the Victorian Institution for Higher Studies, and being introduced to Rhodes Island by Operator Skyfire, many Operators who had not yet met Mint could not help but have certain preconceptions about her. 
Regardless, once they met the new Victorian for themselves, they quickly realized she was not an elite in the vein of Operator Skyfire. This isn't to say Operator Mint isn't outstanding; rather, she and Skyfire are two completely separate sorts. She looks quiet and proper at first glance, but in truth she bursts with a curious spirit and a lively step. Compared to her senior Skyfire, a cream-of-the-crop Caster who gained her qualifications from school and promptly graduated, Mint values her research in geological fields much more. 
It's no surprise that when the time came to decide where she wanted to go, Mint chose to stick around and further her studies, continuing her pursuit of cutting-edge geological research. It was on such a pivotal field investigation that she came to contract Oripathy.

The new Feline girl has a book that'll bite you. 
Once Mint came to Rhodes Island, the rumor swiftly followed, spreading like wildfire amongst the younger Operators. 
Mint does indeed hold an Arts unit, one fashioned into the form of a book, that together with her staff helps her to make full, free use of her Originium Arts. Mint usually has the 'book' bound with a specially made tie, so as not to cause any accidents. It's as the rumors say—the book will bite people. If someone randomly flips its pages, they'll very likely set off its built-in retaliative mechanisms. It won't cause any life-threatening harm, but according to Mint, 'Its bites hurt so much. It's even worse than stubbing your little toe.' 
Mint says she happened upon the book at an old marketplace near school, where all the shops sold old books and worn knick-knacks that had probably traded hands countless times, and where no shortage of questionably-legal goods moved around under wraps. 
'Don't go in there expecting anything. People who treat it as one great treasure hunt by and large end up buying complete useless rubbish, ' stated Operator Skyfire on this topic. 'If you honest-to-God know how to find something nice, you'll find it. If you can't see a thing's true worth, tough. That's the only way. '

Operator Mint's sense of curiosity is extremely strong. 
Most Institution scholars have passion to embrace as they seek the verities of their matters, and Mint is no exception. Though most of the time she comes off simply as polite and sweet, Mint's natural-born curiosity and hunger for knowledge is impossible to hide, and it didn't take long to show once she arrived at Rhodes Island. 
She spent the first couple of days 'exploring' most areas of the ship provided to Operators, before selecting a few lesser trodden places to act as her own secret bases. She's taken to life at Rhodes Island very quickly. 
However, her wildly scattering curiosity has definitely invited trouble at times. 
One thing that worries people is while doing something, Mint is distractable. Of course, this isn't to say she has no sense of priority. When a directly pressing matter is at hand, Mint focuses and spares no detail until it's done, but the moment the most critical part is finished, she loosens up, and it's then that something else can easily steal her attention. 
For example, after a mission, she might be lured away by some novel ore or Originium-infected creature, and will wander off from her team without realizing it until she's lost in the dead of the wilderness... That has happened more than once. 
And if this continues without any mediation or regulation, we fear that Operator Skyfire, who already loses her temper whenever it happens, will sooner or later burn the ship out from the inside.

Mint doesn't seem to be too bothered by her own Oripathy. 
Her infection was completely unforeseen. At the time, a group of scholars had made due preparations and entered a deep fault left by a Catastrophe. Exploration there went without a hitch—only as they withdrew, the ground beneath Mint's footing subsided, and the rest is history. 
Mint herself cares less about her illness, a lost cause as it is, and much more about if she's obtained some good samples for experimentation, or whether she's onto any breakthrough discoveries. Those are what really matter to her. 
After all, geological research has always been part and parcel of all sorts of dangerous environments. No matter the stringent safety measures, no one can guarantee an accident will never occur. Mint and all the researchers with her were all aware of this. It was with a fundamental understanding of the risk that they made their choices. 
Operator Mint has never once been regretful.

Mint likes hiding in her secret bases and reading in silence, and she likes fooling around together with her friends. She likes to climb trees. She likes adventures. She likes every last new and novel thing. 
She might tiptoe as she follows behind her friends, and she might suddenly get distracted by something and go bounding off instead. 
Should you ever receive a small present from her, be it as little as a misshapen piece of ore with mud still stuck to it, take it. Accept it. Without a doubt, it's something she's fond of, and regardless of how, she'd like for you to share in it too.

avgList.storyIntro: Have you ever asked yourself, 'just how did you get so attached?'

stories.storyText:
[Code Name] Surtr
[Gender] Female
[Combat Experience] 2 Years
[Place of Birth] Unknown
[Date of Birth] Jan 22
[Race] Sarkaz
[Height] 162cm
[Infection Status] 
Confirmed Infected by medical examination.

[Physical Strength] Normal
[Mobility] Normal
[Physical Resilience] Normal
[Tactical Acumen] Excellent
[Combat Skill] Normal
[Originium Arts Assimilation] Flawed

Surtr is a mysterious Sarkaz girl who suffers from amnesia, perhaps due to her Oripathy. Her condition is rarely seen even among Infected. She is currently undergoing treatment at Rhodes Island. 
During testing, Surtr displayed an inexplicably high combat prowess, and was quickly drafted as a combat operator.

Imaging tests have shown the outlines of her internal organs to be indistinct due to slight shadows. Minute amounts of Originium granules have been detected in her circulatory system, confirming her to be infected with Oripathy. 

[Cell-Originium Assimilation] 1%
Operator Surtr has basically no signs of infection on the surface of her body. 

[Blood Originium-Crystal Density] 0.10u/L
Operator Surtr's Originium-Crystal density is at the lower end.

Operator Surtr was found in the ruins of a small town ravaged by a Catastrophe, on the outskirts of Ursus. At the time, Rhodes Island operators were carrying out a post-Catastrophe scouting mission and stumbled upon Surtr, who was resting alone in a destroyed building. Assuming that Surtr was a victim of the Catastrophe and afraid that she would fall victim to its aftereffects, the operators decided to bring her back to Rhodes Island. It was only later that we realized Surtr was merely a passing traveler looking for a place to rest.

Though Surtr's combat prowess far surpasses the average combat operator, her power cannot be attributed to any kind of Originium Arts. With the two-handed sword she carries, Surtr can do significant damage to her environs. The sheer heat emitted from the blade can melt most substances, but the theory behind it is difficult to explain. Surtr herself is unable to recall the origin of the sword. It became an indispensable companion without her noticing. Because of this, even if Surtr frequently passes through normal Infected areas, her Infection will not significantly worsen. Whether it will become a key area of interest in the research of Oripathy remains unknown at this point.

Surtr's memory impairment is different from normal amnesia, and is more akin to memory confusion due to overlapping memories within the same period of time. Based on Surtr's explanation, her mind contains many differing memories. In these memories, Surtr herself could be in completely different locations, with completely different interpersonal relationships. Due to the difficulty of investigation, the authenticity of her report cannot be determined as of now. It is unconfirmed if these are really Surtr's own experiences, or others' experiences that Surtr came to treat as her own.

Surtr's lifestyle on the Rhodes Island landship is rather free, without many of the constraints and requirements expected of normal operators. Medical understands her circumstances, and has compiled a partial list of Surtr's memories to aid in her investigation. Surtr spends most of her time looking for clues at the locations in her memories. It is clear that Surtr may never be able to finish investigating all the locations in her memories within her lifetime, but Surtr herself does not seem to mind. Perhaps to her, the journey is far more important than the destination.

[A particular page of Surtr's personal records]
[No permission required for viewing]
Forest, endless trees, stream, carriage, bandits. 
Skyscrapers, alleyway, cake shop, icing, albumen. 
Wasteland, ruins, enemies, friends, a series of explosions. 
Snowy mountain, a barren snowy mountain, unending snowy mountains. 
Castle, stone castle, tower, unopenable door. 
School, street, sports field, newsstand, mugger. 
Police station, interrogation room, timer, criminal. 
Balloons, amusement park, fountain, roller coaster. 
Ocean, sea monster, fishing boats. 
Electric tower, broadcast station, rooftop. 
————
Many lines have been crossed out.

[Code Name] Bubble
[Gender] Female
[Combat Experience] None
[Place of Birth] Sargon
[Date of Birth] Mar 19
[Race] Cerato
[Height] 135cm
[Infection Status] 
Confirmed Infected by medical examination.

[Physical Strength] Excellent
[Mobility] Normal
[Physical Resilience] Excellent
[Tactical Acumen] Normal
[Combat Skill] Flawed
[Originium Arts Assimilation] Standard

A young warrior girl from a tribe of Sargon Ceratos, she is inexperienced, with no knowledge of the norms and customs for interacting with others. Her father sent her to Rhodes Island, ostensibly for 'training,' but actually to treat her Oripathy. 
She uses a massive shield as a weapon, relying on charging and bashing tactics. She needs Rhodes Island training to ensure she doesn't make any catastrophic mistakes in actual combat.

Imaging tests have shown the outlines of her internal organs to be indistinct due to abnormal shadows. Originium granules have been detected in her circulatory system, confirming her to be infected with Oripathy. 

[Cell-Originium Assimilation] 2%
Her left leg shows clear signs of infection. 

[Blood Originium-Crystal Density] 0.24u/L
Infection remains mild, but the patient is often uncooperative with treatment, and there is a possibility her situation could worsen.  

'I hope we don't get too many more difficult patients like her...'

Bubble is the daughter of a Sargon tribal warrior. Our operators made some arrangements with her father before she came to Rhodes Island. We understand she suffered direct contact with Originium while playing in the wilderness, and failure to quickly clean the wound resulted in an irreversible infection. Bubble's father asked that we accept her for treatment, but so as not to embarrass her, he requested that we register her as a reserve operator and note her purpose at Rhodes Island as 'special training.' After her tests, she became a reserve operator.

Bubble makes a lot of trouble for the adults around her, but she's exceedingly popular among children. She is playful, principled, and particularly good at embellishing her 'adventures,' which never fail to draw the kids in for a listen. Even the clever children who know her stories are exaggerated still enjoy listening to Bubble, because those stories are indeed very well-told. 
Bubble has lots of friends, but she is closest to Ceobe. The two hit it off from the first time they met, and one always goes looking for the other whenever she has free time. As for what they talk about, it's what kids always love to talk about: 
'My favorite hero could beat up your favorite hero.' 
Bubble doesn't like to study, but that hasn't kept her from learning all kinds of new phrases, techniques, and rhetorical flourishes to describe her own father during her talks with Ceobe. But the funny thing is that no matter how much vocabulary they prepare beforehand, their arguments always descend into: 'I'm big!' 'I'm bigger!' 'I'm way bigger!' Punctuated with exaggerated gestures, such confrontations can last an entire afternoon.  
I suppose that's just how kids are. 
Looks like they're having fun.

Bubble has not yet grown accustomed to the cramped quarters of Rhodes Island. She is used to life on the wide open plains of Sargon, running across the vast prairies of the wilderness. So when she first came to Rhodes Island, Bubble had an instinctive rejection of the environment. And one way she acted out against our environment was to rampage through the ship, wrecking things. 
Don't underestimate Bubble because of her size. She's trampled robots, crashed through security doors, broken down partition walls, and never once injured herself. Should you ever see her preparing to break into a run, stop her immediately and bring her to the nearest treadmill. Or toss her into the training room, which is the safest and most effective way to deal with a 'Bubble Crisis.' 
Bubble also likes to run around the battlefield during combat. Thanks to her man-sized spiked shield, she is impervious to any threat she can charge straight through. But she tends not to consider that she could still be attacked from the side or the rear, and it is necessary to have other operators cover her. Until she is able to fully comply with dispatch or complete her Defender examination, her deployments will be limited to lower threat missions.

As the daughter of a tribal warrior, Bubble is used to the expectation that she will be a warrior just like her father. Because of her bottomless respect for her father, Bubble has been working to emulate him since she was small. But we have to ask: is Bubble really suited to that kind of life? 
When other children in the tribe were learning the importance of combat skills, Bubble was rushing around, charging into things. She has far more strength and endurance than children of her same cohort, but combat prowess is more than just strength. In the words of her father: 'This girl will not be a warrior.' 
It is perhaps because he recognized this that her father did not permit Bubble to conceal her wounds and carry on with her life, and instead sent her away from the tribe, away from Sargon, and off to a new future of her own making. 
'At least here, she can have a happy life.' It's hard to imagine such words came from a fierce tribal Cerato warrior, his body well over two meters tall covered head to toe in tattoos and totems. Not long after that conversation, our newly arrived Bubble came crashing through the reception room door. Her father apologized profusely to the operator on duty, all the while holding the crying Bubble by her ear. An hour later, after the operator saw off Bubble's father, the young girl helped herself to a snack: the leaves of our potted plant. 
It seems Bubble has a lot of growing up to do.

All our Medic Operators know the futility of trying to get control of a grumpy Bubble. Putting a stop to a charging Cerato is like stopping a hulk of agricultural machinery with a brick on its accelerator.  
But Gavial has done it. 
Not only can Gavial get Bubble under control, but she has no trouble administering injections to the girl. After attempting to resist Gavial several times, to no avail, Bubble has resigned herself to her fate. 
Subsequently, Bubble came to understand Gavial's 'glorious accomplishments' and has since come to worship her. 
And Bubble has been more amenable of late. 
Thanks, Gavial! 
What's more, Bubble has started studying some close combat techniques. When asked why, she replied: 
'I want to pound Kay flat!' 
We know that when Bubble and Ceobe get into one of their 'My Papa could beat up Vulcan' sessions, they sometimes get too into it and the conflict turns physical. They have never drawn weapons and do not escalate beyond shoving. 
In terms of raw power, Bubble is a bit stronger than Ceobe, but Ceobe's extensive experience and conditioned reflexes always put Bubble at a disadvantage, and the noisy little firecracker usually finds herself overwhelmed.  
So Bubble started training. And property damage due to Bubble has also enjoyed a significant reduction. 
Maybe it won't be long before we can declare 'Bubble Crises' a thing of the past.

[Code Name] Aosta
[Gender] Male
[Brawling Experience] 5 Years
[Place of Birth] Siracusa
[Date of Birth] May 9
[Race] Lupo
[Height] 177cm
[Infection Status] 
Crystals have appeared on his body. Infection confirmed by medical examination.

[Physical Strength] Standard 
[Mobility] Standard 
[Physical Resilience] Standard 
[Tactical Acumen] Excellent 
[Combat Skill] Standard 
[Originium Arts Assimilation] Standard

Aosta, former Siracusan mafioso, later became a member of Chiave's gang. 
After a particular incident, he joined Rhodes Island along with his leader, Chiave, and is now active as a front-line attacker.

Imaging tests have shown the outlines of his internal organs to be indistinct due to abnormal shadows. Originium granules have been detected in his circulatory system, confirming him to be infected with Oripathy. 

[Cell-Originium Assimilation] 5%
Small traces of infection are visible on the surface of the body. 

[Blood Originium-Crystal Density] 0.23u/L
Operator Aosta didn't begin treatment until his infection had spread to a considerable extent. All other indicators are normal, which goes to show he leads a healthy lifestyle. Thanks to this, his condition isn't very severe.

Although he tends to keep quiet, Aosta is a dependable Lupo whose demeanor is almost impeccable. 
He may sound a little street with his vocabulary at times, but it's hard to believe he used to be one of Chiave's underlings. 
He's cautious, and he thinks his problems through. That has earned him excellent appraisals from all the operators he's teamed up with.

According to Aosta, his work ethic is a product of his time with Chiave.
Indeed, Aosta is careful, if you're feeling generous, but less charitably, he's way too anxious. It's astonishing to see someone as young as him possess such a pessimistic personality, but when you look at Chiave, this perhaps may not be so strange.
Chiave made all the decisions about what to do, Aosta decided how to go about doing them, and Broca did all the hard work. It's clear they made it this far in no small part thanks to Aosta's meticulous planning.

Aosta is the most skilled in handicraft of this trio. 
More specifically, he has experience in everything from simple origami to complex sewing. If there's anything he hasn't tried his hand at making before, he's able to make something fairly close after just a few glances. 
It's a talent rarely seen here in Rhodes Island—we've also got no plans to hire a full-time tailor here—and that has made him hugely popular among our female operators. He's become far busier outside of his deployments. It doesn't seem like he minds at all, though. He's taken on a variety of requests, and he even seems to be enjoying the work.

Out of the three, Aosta is the only one who has an understanding of Siracusa's inner workings as a country. 
Even though he grew up in Siracusa and never traveled abroad, he still understood Siracusa's uniqueness. As we all know, the way Siracusa operates is fundamentally different from how other countries are run. There, the families run the show behind all public affairs. 
Thanks to this unique characteristic, life in Siracusa is quite strange even in this diverse world, and Aosta understands clearly that the Siracusan lifestyle is not what people of other origins would consider normal. 
It's difficult to say what makes a normal lifestyle and what doesn't. However, when the authorities avoid getting involved with the wars between families, it's safe to say that life in Siracusa can hardly be called normal. 
Aosta knows so much about the environment he grew up in, and still manages to harbor such doubts about the place. You don't come across people like that often. The good thing about this is that he was able to adjust to life in Rhodes Island very quickly. Unlike Chiave, who took a very long time just to accept and follow the rules here.

avgList.storyIntro: Perhaps this is the way of life he wanted. Perhaps he could seize it with his own hands.

stories.storyText:
[Code Name] Whislash
[Gender] Female
[Competition Knight Experience] 4 Years
[Place of Birth] Kazimierz
[Date of Birth] Jun 28
[Race] Kuranta
[Height] 165cm
[Infection Status] 
Medical tests have confirmed that no infection is present.

[Physical Strength] Standard
[Mobility] Standard
[Physical Resilience] Standard
[Tactical Acumen] Excellent
[Combat Skills] Excellent
[Originium Arts Assimilation] Standard

Whislash Zofia, former competitive Kazimierz Knight. In family terms, Operators Nearl and Blemishine's aunt on their father's side. Has reached the Final 16 of the Majors before. Was left-handed in the past, but owing to some impairment, has switched to using her right hand. 
Though atrophied in combat compared to her peak, she holds unique insight and a rare talent in training others, currently folding herself into the Instructor lineup headed by Dobermann. Training Operators is her day-to-day priority, only joining any missions as required.

Imaging tests reveal clear, normal outlines of internal organs, and no abnormal shadows have been detected. Originium granules have not been detected in the circulatory system and there is no sign of infection. At this time, this operator is believed to be uninfected. 

[Cell-Originium Assimilation] 0%
Operator Whislash shows no signs of Originium infection. 

[Blood Originium-Crystal Density] 0.12u/L
Operator Whislash rarely comes into contact with Originium.

The distantly removed aunt of Nearl and Blemishine. A Kuranta madam with a domineering streak. 
Possesses bountiful Kazimierz assets from her winnings in the competition knight circuit, but seems not to take much interest in her own wealth. 
She's got no ill will at all, but when chatting with her, you may invariably feel she projects a sort of arrogance. As long as you push past that first impression of yours, getting along with her is easy as could be.

At the outset, Whislash had a prolonged dispute with Dobermann, which at its root was due to their conflicting views on the training of operators. 
Dobermann, of military birth, believes that operators should be required to attain what she sees as average proficiency for a combatant, afterwards earning the right to choose how they develop themselves. Whislash of competition knight lineage, however, doesn't care at all whether operators meet a uniform average, instead aspiring to bring each operator's own characteristics to their maximum potential. 
Neither's way of thinking is wrong, but even so, Dobermann and Whislash are both particularly stubborn. They were at an impasse for a while, before finally taking a meeting and reaching a compromise. 
Though perhaps they came to understand each other while butting heads. Ever since then, their relationship's gotten pretty good. You might hear them talking tactics from time to time now, or even just eating meals together.

While she is Nearl and Blemishine's aunt, Zofia the Whislash does not take the surname Nearl. Strictly speaking, she cannot, since her standing is as a branch member of the Nearl family, which bars her from directly taking up the name. 
But this was policy for the Nearl family at its shining peak. Following Nearl's exile, it might've been simple enough, with all that she possessed, to seize the title of Nearl if she so wished. 
Mind you, Whislash did not. 
One part of it was her sisterly relationship with Maria. The other, as she saw it, was that the Nearl name held hallowed significance. 
In a certain sense, her opinion overlaps with a true direct relative of Nearl's and Blemishine's, their uncle, Młynar—'This is not a name I'd tarnish with such underhandedness.' 
Though, sure enough, they define 'tarnishing' in different ways. 
Unlike Młynar, Zofia does not reject the idea of the competition knight itself. Put another way, she accepts at least its existence—but does not err in her forthright and sporting approach to dueling, which she took to the competition as humble representative of the Nearl family. Unwilling to bow to any sponsors or firms, she went from start to finish lacking any favorable provisions or equipment, until the Final 16 brought her journey to an end. Even now, despite that gulf in equipment taking her left hand out of action indefinitely, she has no regrets. None—come the Major, she wants to make sure Blemishine continues to fight as she once did.  
It's plain how in Whislash's heart of hearts, her honor as a member of the Nearl family is unbreakable, and anyone could see how she looks after Nearl and Blemishine. When joining, she even assured us that if Rhodes Island wasn't fit for purpose, she'd prefer to take Nearl and Blemishine with her to raise them herself. We've had some personnel envy the sisters in a way, having an elder who cares for them like that.

When joining us, it seemed that as long as Nearl and Blemishine were doing well, Whislash wouldn't have any issue with us. But as time passed, as other operators arrived, and showed her ever more ways of life from ever more corners of Terra... chatting with the Doctor one day, she posed a question she'd never thought of asking before—somehow, she'd never considered what she wanted to do herself.  
Safeguarding the Nearl family name, looking after Nearl and Blemishine. These were what she wanted to do, but somehow not all she wanted to do. 
Ever since Nearl was cast out, she'd found a new purpose for herself. Maria had jumped headlong into her beloved engineering. The name of Nearl was all but safe. Once everything she'd worried about no longer needed her, the realization struck her—she had no idea what should come next. 
Blessedly, the operators of Rhodes Island not only reminded her of life's variety, but that the vast majority of it was open to try herself. After a short period of haziness, Whislash decided to continue as an Instructor on the one hand, while trying all sorts of new things she'd never imagined on the other. She could seek out her new purpose in life. After all, she's young, life's long, and it's not like there's a rush.

[Code Name] Blemishine
[Gender] Female
[Competition Knight Experience] 6 Months
[Place of Birth] Kazimierz
[Date of Birth] July 15
[Race] Kuranta
[Height] 165cm
[Infection Status] 
Medical tests have confirmed that no infection is present.

[Physical Strength] Standard
[Mobility] Excellent
[Physical Resilience] Standard
[Tactical Acumen] Standard
[Combat Skill] Standard
[Originium Arts Assimilation] Excellent

Maria Nearl, a young knight from Kazimierz and younger sister to Operator Nearl, has experience with knight sports and has demonstrated excellence in combat across a variety of tests. She now serves as a Defender Operator alongside Operator Nearl, as per her wishes.

Imaging tests reveal clear, normal outlines of internal organs, and no abnormal shadows have been detected. Originium granules have not been detected in the circulatory system and there is no sign of infection. At this time, this operator is believed to be uninfected. 

[Cell-Originium Assimilation] 0%
Operator Blemishine shows no signs of Originium infection at all. 

[Blood Originium-Crystal Density] 0.13u/L
Operator Blemishine rarely comes into contact with Originium.
